comments:
As stated, a single project in the workspace occurs multiple times in the J2EE Module Dependencies property page for a project. Selecting either one of those entries will result in an "IWAE0010E An internal error has occured:" message when applying.
As there's no way to select these projects in another way this makes publishing a project with dependencies inpossible.

Created an attachment (id=36229)
Picture of duplicate entries and the error message
Can this be reproduced on windows?

I do not know if this reproduces on Windoze; I do not have any Windows machines available.
I did find out something else: it has something to do with the server installed. I checked out my projects in a clean eclipse install and a clean workspace. At that time the project had no duplicate entries. After that I defined a server (thru preferences, then in the servers view). The duplicate entries are now present.
Deleting the server entry does not fix the problem though.
I noticed though that adding a project to the j2ee deplist causes that project to be altered by Eclipse(!?): the .project file gets the wst facet nature and builders added. Removing these by hand from the .project file removes the dup entry.
The error message IWA0010E does not seem to be directly related to the dup entries: i got it too when I added a project while the list held no duplicates.

Created an attachment (id=36374)
PATCH: Remove duplicate project entries

This uses a hashset to filter out duplicate projects added to the dependencies dialog. It does not fix the "IWAE0010E" error.

Created an attachment (id=36375)
PATCH: sort the J2EE dependencies list

Just sorts the list.

The "IWAE0010E" error is caused by an exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.operation.CreateReferenceComponentsOp.addProjectReferences(CreateReferenceComponentsOp.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.operation.CreateReferenceComponentsOp.execute(CreateReferenceComponentsOp.java:40)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.ui.RunnableOperationWrapper.run(RunnableOperationWrapper.java:32)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.ui.WorkspaceModifyComposedOperation.execute(WorkspaceModifyComposedOperation.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1733)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

I'm going to look into that tomorrow; the learning curve is kind of steep :-)
John - sending back your way to review/potentially commit the patches
Released for the WTP 1.5 RC1 driver 042006
